alert.note: Alert for Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Boyd, northwestern Lawrence, southeastern Carter and northwestern Wayne Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 659 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Yatesville Lake State Park, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and up to half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wayne, Yatesville Lake State Park, Webbville, Princess, Durbin, Coalton, Denton, Burnaugh, Centerville, Rush, Lockwood, Willard, Hitchins, Buchanan, Houckville, Fallsburg and Mavity. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 179 and 185. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
